column10: Notes
Leaves Cuba to study art under Fernando Alvarez de Sotomayor y Zaragoza, curator of Museo del Prado
Spanish Civil War, injury
Meets Picasso with letter of introduction
Left with André Breton and Claude Levi-Strauss for Martinique and interned at Lazaret Camp for 40 days allowed to leave for Cuba
aboard the cargo ship Presidente Trujillo
visa
visa
Forced exile. Did not receive visa for NY or Mexico must return to Cuba.
Invited with his wife by Pierre Mabille, 4 months with André Breton

Stopover through Breton encounters Marcel Duchamp and Jeanne Raynal who present him to Nicolas Calas, Roberto Matta, Isamu Nogochi, Arshile Gorky, Robert Motherwell, Sonia Sekula, David Hare, Gerome Kamrowski, Frederick Kiesler
Summer months, his wife Helena finds work in NY
Decides to settle in Paris because of unrest under Batista
Watches a bullfight with Picasso

Sundays with Césaire "He joined Césaire every Sunday for afternoons of conversation with a group of friends, hosted by Césaire's Martiniquan friends Dr Auguste Thésee and his wife Françoise. After a Creole meal, their animated discussions were the occasion for Lam to indulge in another of his passions: economics and politics."
Lam won the gold medal of the Lissone Prize, awarded to foreigners, for his large canvas La Fiancée.
Met with art critic Alain Jouffroy
Returned for medical care after contracting chlorosis in travels through the Maroni, Orinoco and Amazon rivers.
Centro de Bellas Artes
Inaguration of his fresco at botanical gardens
Time spent with future wife Lou Laurin
With Lou Laurin, Funeral of Diego Rivera
Towards end of February, meets with José Álvarez Baragaño
The day of a general strike in Cuba
Met up with friends Jesse Fernández, Carlos Rigaudias, Eugenio Granell
stayed with their friends the Crippas, then Jorn
Enrico Baj was working with ceramics
Elected for the Graham Foundation for Advanced Studies in the Fine Arts
Summer with Lou Laurin
Marriage to Lou Laurin
Invited by Lindy and Edwin Bergman
Birth of son with Lou Laurin, Eskil
Summer months spent here
Second son with Lou Laurin born, Timour
Summer spent in Albissola again before establishing a studio for next 20 years
Hailed as a hero and "national painter"

Attended the annual festival of ceramics, at which he was again in the company of his friends Jorn and Fontana, but also the sculptors Agenore Fabbri and Aligi Sassu, the Polish artist Maria Papa Rostkowska and her companion, and the art critic San Lazzaro, who founded the Parisian gallery and review XXe Siècle the year before and which published one of Lam’s color lithographs, Affinités ambiguës. Lam began designing and executing a mosaic for the boardwalk in Albissola, his participation in a commissioned work involving some thirty local artists, most of them Italian

The family settled into an apartment on the Rue de la Convention in the 15th arrondissement – the children's education being the primary motive for choosing Paris. Every month, Lam commuted between Albissola and Paris to be with them.
Received Guggenheim International Award
Marzotto Prize
Summer with Gherasmin Luca
Zette and Michele Leiris

Participated in a sort of happening on the plaza of the Contrescarpe, Paris. Participating artists: Alechinsky, Matta, Adami, Arroyo, J.-J. Lebel and Rotella. Organized by the Italian art dealer, Ivanohe Trivulzio, they burned 13 canvases after producing photo-lithographs of each painting – a gesture to promote affordable art.
Summer with family
Invited to visit Alexander Calder
Carlos Franqui invites for a second time for solo exhibition. Filmed by Manuel Lamar. Lam meets Fidel Castro. Visits with sister Augustina
Layover with Aeroflot direct from Havana
Visit with Picasso
Funeral of Andre Breton, Graham Greene, 11-19 Grand and Petit Palais Picasso Major Retrospective
Retrospective
Retrospective
Retrospective
23rd Salon de Mai

Flew with family to Cuba to organize exhibition of 100 artisits chosen with Lou Laurin with Fidel Castro. For the Salon, scheduled to take place from July 30 to September 7 in Havana and from September to October in Santiago. Lam was there, waiting on the tarmac, to welcome the new arrivals: Zette and Michel Leiris, Camacho, Cardénas, José Pierre, Zimbacca, Jean Schuster, Appel, César, Corneille, Erro, Hundertwasser, Pignon, Poliakoff, Vasarely, Monory, Ribeyrolles, Adami, Alechinsky, Arman, Penrose, Jouffroy, Luca, Nadeau

Habana Libre Hotel. Late December, in the company of Leiris, Césaire, Jorn, Naville, Max-Pol Fouchet, Georges Limbour, Joyce Mansour, Matta, Jouffroy, René Louis des Forêts, Dionys Mascolo, Duras, Alechinsky, Edouard Pignon, Jean Schuster, Maurice Nadeau. Listened to Castro's speeches. In January takes friedns to his birthplace Sagua La Grande.
Birth of son Jonas with Lou Laurin, moves to apartment at Boulevard de Beauséjour in Paris
VIIe Bienalle de Menton
commemoration of the 30th Anniversary of the American Rescue Committee
Musée national des Arts et Traditions populaires inauguration
Venice Biennal
To visit Picasso exhibition after his death

Family Christmas holidays, the Benares Shoals and Mahabalipuram (southern India), on the coast, in the north at Pondicherry where they visited the ruins of the sanctuary consecrated to Shiva and Vishnu from the 12th century
Easter holiday
Easter holiday
Reconnected with Gabriel Garcia Marquez and Rene Portocarrero
Centre Pompidou
Transfered here after suffering a stroke in Milan
Despite being partially paralyzed attended Wifredo Lam, coleccion Museo Nacional de Bellas Artes de la Habana, Cuba
Sought treament at Franck Pais hospital. Learns of death of Alejo Carpentier. Lam attends burial in Cuba
Summer with family
Winter
Summer

Death. He was incinerated at the Père-Lachaise cemetery in Paris and his family, respecting his wishes, flew to Cuba to confide his ashes to Cuban soil. national funeral was organized on December 8, 1982, in Havana, during which his wife Lou Laurin-Lam, in the presence of Fidel Castro, deposited Wifredo Lam’s ashes in the Colón cemetery.
